A DellaVigna and Kaplan (2007) DellaVigna and Kaplan (2007) (henceforth DVK) compare changes in presidential vote shares in towns which had access to the Fox News Channel by the year 2000 compared to towns that did not conditional on a rich set of co-variates. The first-order problem in DVKÃÂ¢Ãâ¬Ãâ¢s data is severe mis-measurement due to non-updated entries. Specifically, 37% of control group observations, the towns which the DVK data indicate did not have cable access to the Fox News Channel in the year 2000, actually did have access to Fox News, but were not properly updated in that data source. In fact, about 25% of these towns already had cable access to the Fox News Channel in 1998. When one re-runs their specifications with the Nielsen FOCUS data,44 one draws new inferences from the estimated coefficients in DVKÃÂ¢Ãâ¬Ãâ¢s two preferred specifications.
